habitat: Grows on termite nests in tropical and subtropical forests, mainly during the rainy months (May–October). Forms a symbiotic relationship with termites.
shortDescription: A highly valued mushroom with sweet, nutty flavor and medicinal benefits; relies on termite nests for growth.
benefitsOrToxicity: Safe for human consumption, rich vitamins

identification.cap: White to light yellow, 3–7 cm in diameter; meaty and chewy with mild aroma that intensifies when cooked.

medicinalProperties: Immune booster, digestive support, heart health, anti-inflammatory, antidiabetic, hepatoprotective, neuritogenic, antioxidant activity.
note: Not cultivated artificially due to termite dependence; wild harvesting should follow sustainable practices; cook before consumption.
